content.raw:
I think a zero rate implies nothing will be published. But looking at the code, when the rate is `<= 0` (which includes the default value 0), the interval is set to 1 sec (i.e. 1 Hz). 

Would it be clearer to say that the default rate is 1 Hz?
content.html:
I think a zero rate implies nothing will be published. But looking at the code, when the rate is <= 0 (which includes the default value 0), the interval is set to 1 sec (i.e. 1 Hz).

Would it be clearer to say that the default rate is 1 Hz?

content.raw:
I'm testing the example world using the playstation joystick on Xenial and :

* after the first few messages, messages keep being published but the timestamp doesn't change. I also put a print statement next to the lines which set the timestamp and saw that they stop being called after a while.
* Buttons / axes don't seem to be updated even for a single iteration
content.html:
I'm testing the example world using the playstation joystick on Xenial and :

  • after the first few messages, messages keep being published but the timestamp doesn't change. I also put a print statement next to the lines which set the timestamp and saw that they stop being called after a while.
  • Buttons / axes don't seem to be updated even for a single iteration

content.raw:
I'm testing the following patch:

~~~
diff -r f136155a65e1 cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
--- a/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake	Fri Jan 19 15:54:51 2018 -0800
+++ b/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake	Fri Jan 19 16:18:45 2018 -0800
@@ -585,19 +585,13 @@
 ########################################
 # Find SDFormat
 # try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6
-set (SDFormat_MIN_VERSION 5)
-find_package(SDFormat 6 QUIET)
+set (SDFormat_MIN_VERSION 6)
+find_package(SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION})
 if (SDFormat_FOUND)
-  message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat 6 - found")
+  message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} - found")
 else ()
-  # try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6
-  find_package(SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION})
-  if (NOT SDFormat_FOUND)
-    message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat 5 or 6 - not found")
-    BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: SDF version >=${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} <= 6. Required for reading and writing SDF files.")
-  else()
-    message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} - found")
-  endif()
+  message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} - not found")
+  BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: SDF version >=${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION}. Required for reading and writing SDF files.")
 endif()
 
 ########################################
~~~
content.html:
I'm testing the following patch:

diff -r f136155a65e1 cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake
--- a/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake    Fri Jan 19 15:54:51 2018 -0800
+++ b/cmake/SearchForStuff.cmake    Fri Jan 19 16:18:45 2018 -0800
@@ -585,19 +585,13 @@
 ########################################
 # Find SDFormat
 # try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6
-set (SDFormat_MIN_VERSION 5)
-find_package(SDFormat 6 QUIET)
+set (SDFormat_MIN_VERSION 6)
+find_package(SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION})
 if (SDFormat_FOUND)
-  message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat 6 - found")
+  message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} - found")
 else ()
-  # try finding both sdformat 5 and 6 until we switch to 6
-  find_package(SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION})
-  if (NOT SDFormat_FOUND)
-    message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat 5 or 6 - not found")
-    BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: SDF version >=${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} <= 6. Required for reading and writing SDF files.")
-  else()
-    message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} - found")
-  endif()
+  message (STATUS "Looking for SDFormat ${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION} - not found")
+  BUILD_ERROR ("Missing: SDF version >=${SDFormat_MIN_VERSION}. Required for reading and writing SDF files.")
 endif()

 ########################################
